medical_history.chief_complaint: Sudden onset right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient woke up at 6am with RUQ pain that has been present since then. The pain does not radiate, is mostly constant and dull but intermittently sharp and stabbing. The pain worsened throughout the day, and the patient reported it worsened to a higher intensity by the time of ED evaluation. The patient experienced large volumes of yellow, non-bloody emesis and has been unable to tolerate oral intake.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Irritable bowel syndrome, gastroesophageal reflux disease, hypothyroidism (status post ablation for thyrotoxicosis), obesity, fibroid uterus, menometrorrhagia, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, history of HPV infection.
medical_history.family_history: Polycystic kidney disease in brothers; positive for lung and skin cancer; no known history of inflammatory bowel disease or nephrolithiasis.
